choices.answer: Feeling With Someone
Being happy with what you have in life
Feeling remorse for something you may have done
Feeling lonely or isolated

questions.question: What is the definition of Gratitude?
What is the most basic necessity we should be grateful for in life?

choices.answer: Food
Clothing
Shelter
All of the above

questions.question: Your parents bought you a used laptop. Your best friend’s parents got him a better one. You:

choices.answer: You are thankful to your parents and appreciate it
You get angry at your parents
You get angry towards your best friend
You break your best friends laptop

questions.question: When it comes to Christmas gifts, you’re most excited about:

choices.answer: getting them.
giving them.
give him a big hug and listen to it a couple of times.
thank him, but exchange it.
frown. If he’d asked, you’d have told him what you wanted.

questions.question: Your little brother saved all his allowance to buy you an album he thought you’d like. You:

choices.answer: are totally embarrassed with the rusted-out grandma car.
appreciate that they’ve given you the best they could.

questions.question: The car your parents just bought you is old, dirty and doesn’t have a radio. So you:
You were sick, your best friend delivers your homework for an entire week. You:

choices.answer: totally forget to thank him.
drop him a quick e-mail or text, just to say thanks.
Feel really angry towards him

questions.question: Your dad lost his job before Christmas. You:

choices.answer: feel sorry for yourself, but try not to complain.
tell your parents not to worry about giving you gifts.
remind them they still have credit cards they could use.

questions.question: Your parents agreed to help you buy an iPad Pro if you chip in half. You’re:

choices.answer: really grateful. It’s nice of them to help you.
are annoyed. Why should you have to pay for any of it?
A week.
you don’t send thank you notes.

questions.question: When you’ve received a gift, how long does it take you to send a thank you note?
When you look at the stuff you have crammed into your room, you:

choices.answer: sometimes wish you had more.
realise you need to get a box to donate to the charity.
wish you had more money to buy the things you really like.
have a lot of fun. You don’t mind just looking.
always feel a little down as you can't afford the things.
wish you could have afforded the designer clothes.
complain to your parents until they give you extra money.
appreciate you can get new stuff at all.

questions.question: When you buy some new clothes, you:
